capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, you know, the professor of Charms. I've always believed that a good mantra can make all the difference in a student's magical education. It's not just about reciting words, it's about focus and intention. When I teach my classes, I emphasize the importance of finding a personal mantra that resonates with each individual.

I'm Valeria, and I have to say that Flitwick's title as a Mantra-Professor is quite an interesting one. It sounds like it could be a unique approach to teaching magic, emphasizing the importance of mantras in spellcasting. I find it fascinating that he would choose to focus on this aspect of magic, and I'm curious to learn more about his methods and how they've impacted his students over the years.

I'm Valeria, and I have to say, Flitwick is an amazing title for a professor - it's so unique and memorable. As a mantra, it really resonates with me, you know? It's like a personal affirmation that reminds me of the importance of being wise and knowledgeable in my own field.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.
